name: Tokyo
description: Tokyo is a city of contrasts where ultramodern skyscrapers stand alongside historic temples. As the world's largest metropolitan area, it offers unparalleled convenience, safety, and endless opportunities for work and play. From the fashion-forward streets of Shibuya to the traditional gardens of Asakusa, Tokyo has something for everyone.

seasons.name: Spring
seasons.description: Cherry blossoms in late March-April. Mild temperatures perfect for exploring.

seasons.name: Summer
seasons.description: Hot and humid with festivals and fireworks. Air conditioning is essential.

seasons.name: Autumn
seasons.description: Beautiful foliage in November. Comfortable temperatures.

seasons.name: Winter
seasons.description: Mild and dry. Great for sightseeing without crowds.

fitFor: Food enthusiasts with access to 200+ Michelin-starred restaurants
Those who value convenience and public transportation
Investors looking for stable rental yields
notFor: Those seeking large living spaces on a budget
People who prefer quiet, rural environments
Those uncomfortable with crowds and busy streets

propertyTypes.description: Most common. Modern buildings with security and amenities.
High-rise luxury condos with concierge, gym, and views.
Older condos in prime locations. Often larger and more affordable.

name: Osaka
description: Osaka is known for its outgoing locals, incredible street food, and vibrant nightlife. More affordable than Tokyo but equally dynamic, it's Japan's second-largest city with excellent infrastructure and a unique character. The city is famous for its direct, friendly people and its unofficial motto: 'kuidaore' (eat until you drop).

seasons.name: Spring
seasons.description: Cherry blossoms at Osaka Castle. Pleasant weather.

seasons.name: Summer
seasons.description: Hot and humid. Famous Tenjin Festival in July.

seasons.name: Autumn
seasons.description: Comfortable temperatures. Great for exploring.

seasons.name: Winter
seasons.description: Mild compared to Tokyo. Light jacket weather.

fitFor: Food lovers who want daily access to amazing street food
Those who prefer a more relaxed, friendly atmosphere
Business travelers needing Kansai region access
Investors seeking higher yields than Tokyo
notFor: Those who prefer Tokyo's sophistication and pace
People who need maximum English support
highlights: Easy access to Kyoto and Nara

propertyTypes.description: Modern units in the city center with good transit access.
Single-room apartments popular with investors. High yield potential.
Detached homes in residential areas.

name: Kyoto
description: The ancient capital of Japan, Kyoto is a living museum of Japanese culture. With 17 UNESCO World Heritage sites, thousands of temples and shrines, and preserved traditional neighborhoods, it offers a unique lifestyle immersed in history. Despite its traditional image, Kyoto is also home to major universities and tech companies.

seasons.name: Spring
seasons.description: Iconic cherry blossoms. Peak tourist season.

seasons.name: Summer
seasons.description: Hot with the famous Gion Festival in July.

seasons.name: Autumn
seasons.description: Spectacular fall foliage at temples. Very popular.

seasons.name: Winter
seasons.description: Quiet and atmospheric. Occasional snow on temples.

fitFor: Those seeking a quieter, more traditional lifestyle
Those interested in traditional Japanese arts
notFor: Those seeking vibrant nightlife
People who prefer modern architecture
Those uncomfortable with seasonal tourist crowds

propertyTypes.description: Traditional wooden townhouse. Renovated options available.
Contemporary units with traditional area access.
Renovated traditional house. Popular for guesthouses.

name: Fukuoka
description: Consistently ranked as Japan's most livable city, Fukuoka offers the perfect balance of urban convenience and relaxed lifestyle. Located on the northern shore of Kyushu, it's closer to Seoul than Tokyo, making it a gateway to Asia. The city is famous for its yatai (street food stalls), beautiful beaches, and thriving startup scene.
accessFromAirport: 5 min by subway from Fukuoka Airport

seasons.name: Spring
seasons.description: Mild and pleasant. Cherry blossoms in early April.

seasons.name: Summer
seasons.description: Hot and humid but cooled by sea breezes.

seasons.name: Autumn
seasons.description: Best season. Comfortable temperatures.

seasons.name: Winter
seasons.description: Milder than Tokyo. Rarely snows.

fitFor: Food lovers (famous for tonkotsu ramen and yatai)
notFor: Those needing maximum English support
People requiring direct international flights to many destinations

propertyTypes.description: Modern condos with sea views available.
High-yield apartments near universities and business districts.
Spacious homes in residential areas.

name: Hokkaido
description: Japan's northernmost island offers a completely different experience: wide-open spaces, world-class skiing, fresh seafood, and a frontier spirit. Sapporo, the capital, is a modern city with excellent infrastructure, while resort towns like Niseko attract international visitors year-round.
accessFromAirport: 40 min from New Chitose Airport to Sapporo

seasons.name: Spring
seasons.description: Late spring blooms in May. Cool temperatures.

seasons.name: Summer
seasons.description: Perfect weather. Escape from mainland heat.

seasons.name: Autumn
seasons.description: Early fall colors. Harvest season.

seasons.name: Winter
seasons.description: Heavy snowfall. World-famous powder snow.

fitFor: Those who love four distinct seasons
notFor: Those who dislike cold winters
People needing year-round warm weather
Those requiring major city convenience

propertyTypes.description: Slope-side or resort area units. Popular for rental income.
Urban living with all conveniences.
Standalone properties for personal use or rental.

name: Okinawa
description: Okinawa offers a completely different Japan: tropical climate, crystal-clear waters, unique Ryukyu culture, and a laid-back island lifestyle. The 'Hawaii of Japan' attracts those seeking year-round warmth, water sports, and a slower pace of life while still enjoying Japanese safety and infrastructure.
accessFromAirport: 15 min from Naha Airport to city center

seasons.name: Spring
seasons.description: Warm and pleasant. Cherry blossoms in January-February.

seasons.name: Summer
seasons.description: Hot but with ocean breezes. Typhoon season June-October.

seasons.name: Autumn
seasons.description: Still warm. Great for beach activities.

seasons.name: Winter
seasons.description: Mild (15-20°C). Whale watching season.

fitFor: Those interested in unique Ryukyu culture
notFor: Those who prefer big city life
People uncomfortable with typhoon season
Those needing direct international flights

propertyTypes.description: Ocean-view units with resort amenities.
Standalone properties near beaches.
Urban convenience in the capital city.

name: Nagano
description: Host of the 1998 Winter Olympics, Nagano offers stunning mountain scenery, world-class ski resorts like Hakuba, and easy access to Tokyo via shinkansen. The region is perfect for those seeking outdoor activities, hot springs, and a connection to nature while remaining connected to urban conveniences.

seasons.name: Spring
seasons.description: Mountain flowers bloom. Hiking season begins.

seasons.name: Summer
seasons.description: Cool mountain air. Escape the heat.

seasons.name: Autumn
seasons.description: Spectacular mountain foliage.

seasons.name: Winter
seasons.description: Heavy snow. Excellent skiing conditions.

notFor: Those needing big city conveniences daily
People who prefer warm climates
Those without a car (for rural areas)
highlights: 90 min to Tokyo by bullet train

propertyTypes.description: Properties in or near ski resorts.
Traditional or modern houses with mountain views.
Urban base with easy mountain access.

name: Yokohama
description: Japan's second-largest city by population, Yokohama offers a unique blend of international heritage, modern bay-side living, and easy Tokyo access. The city has a more relaxed feel than Tokyo while offering world-class dining, shopping, and entertainment along its famous waterfront.

seasons.name: Spring
seasons.description: Cherry blossoms along the bay. Pleasant temperatures.

seasons.name: Summer
seasons.description: Sea breezes help moderate the heat.

seasons.name: Autumn
seasons.description: Clear skies and comfortable weather.

seasons.name: Winter
seasons.description: Mild winters with spectacular holiday illuminations.

fitFor: Those wanting Tokyo access with more space
Families seeking good schools and parks
notFor: Those wanting to be in central Tokyo
People seeking traditional Japanese atmosphere

propertyTypes.description: Modern high-rises with water views.
Spacious units in residential areas.
Character properties in Yamate/Motomachi.
